summary: Eiji Aonuma Says That It's "Very Interesting To Me" That People Are "Going Straight Into The Thought Of Co-Op" In Breath Of The...
title: Eiji Aonuma Says That It's "Very Interesting To Me" That People Are "Going Straight Into The Thought Of Co-Op" In Breath Of The Wild 2
body:
Eiji Aonuma Says That It’s “Very Interesting To Me” That People Are “Going Straight Into The Thought Of Co-Op” In Breath Of The Wild 2

It is an understatement to say that the sequel to Zelda: Breath Of The Wild has a lot of people talking. Most of the E3 2019interviews that we have been sharing with you have involved this game, and day 2 of E3 has only just wrapped up. The latest example of this comes from IGN. Not only are people talking about the possibility of Zelda being playable, but IGN talked to Zelda series producer…

View On WordPress

summary: It took a while, since I'm not good at clothes with a ton of details like the Fire Emblem Awakening clothes, but I finished...
body:
It took a while, since I’m not good at clothes with a ton of details like the Fire Emblem Awakening clothes, but I finished drawing this to celebrate the end of Nintendo Treehouse Live Day 3 (a couple of hours late but I did it)

I’m hoping the new FE game will let me be a spell caster, I loved that the most, I love choosing the mage character in any RPG.

So yeah, Art of the Day~

summary: DAEMON X MACHINA coming to Nintendo Switch  When the moon tore apart, the sky bled red with light, ushering in an apocalyptic...
caption:
DAEMON X MACHINA coming to Nintendo Switch

When the moon tore apart, the sky bled red with light, ushering in an apocalyptic new age…and to survive, you must fight. As a mercenary, defend Earth through high-speed combat against corrupted robots in a series of missions from the cockpit of your Arsenal, a fully customizable mech. Equip your Arsenal with a vast array of parts and weapons, obtain more from downed enemy Arsenals, and swap them on the fly to suit your strategy in the face of ever-rising threats.

tags: the legend of zelda: breath of the wild
the legend of zelda: breath of the wild sequel
summary:
Guys, if you listen to this video (best at .75x speed) you hear a voice mixed in with the music say,
"Oh, Zelda. Oh, Link....
body:
Guys, if you listen to this video (best at .75x speed) you hear a voice mixed in with the music say,

“Oh, Zelda. Oh, Link. Please find my body”

.

1st Theory.) Its Ganon’s voice, worming it’s way into the subconscious of Zelda & Link to urge them to find his body, knowing that their presence will reanimate his true corpse/self. Maybe it has something to do with the three bearers/representations of the triforce all coming together as one?

2nd Theory.) Its the ethereal, disembodied owner of the pale-energy hand pinning Ganon down — The deep, underground cavern Zelda & Link are riddled with many, large luminous stones.

An ore we know from in-game canon to be quite rare, and to also get its eerie glow from the souls of the dead ensconced within them. What if it’s the souls of these dead beckoning Zelda & Link forward to find their bodies, to release them from their fate?

Either way, unintended or not, this voice is surely creepy and sure gets the mind going!

summary: Nintendo Download, June 13, 2019: Drop the Legendary Beats
title: Nintendo Download, June 13, 2019: Drop the Legendary Beats
body:
Look at all these awesome games!!!

This week’s Nintendo Download includes the following featured content:

  • Nintendo eShop on Nintendo Switch
    • Cadence of Hyrule: Crypt of the NecroDancer Featuring the Legend of Zelda – In the Cadence of Hyrule: Crypt of the NecroDancer Featuring the Legend of Zelda game, each move you make – whether it’s moving, attacking, defending, using items or more – must be timed to the beat of the music,…

blog.description:
Another Video Game / Pop Culture Blog that you won't agree with and isn't really about news though people will cite it our opinions as facts and our articles a baseless nonsense. In other words journalism in the present day.
If I didn't lose you yet than welcome to a blog surrounding video game culture anywhere from Steam Sales to Flash Games. 
From indie to triple A games. Thanks for sticking around! 
Remember, It only takes 3!

summary:
Nintendo's E3 was short but sweet
  June 13th 2019    News / Nintendo / E3
 

 
 Lino Cordova | Writer and Otaku Weeb...
caption:
Nintendo’s E3 was short but sweet

June 13th 2019    News / Nintendo / E3

 Lino Cordova | Writer and Otaku Weeb Trash      

      In terms of announcements there were some interesting titles (basically ports). Titles like the Witcher 3 and Alien Isolation are not titles I would ever imagine getting a port to switch. It lets me reminisce over the days when about 2 years ago a TitanFall Developer said.

      “Fuck no! No, you’re not going to be able to fit Titanfall 2 on the Nintendo Switch!”

      He lightly added that Nintendo catered the “kids” market (which in large part was true at the time). It really goes to show that the Switch truly has come a long way. Although it was mainly ports and Nintendo didn’t have any major announcements to make aside from the new Smash Fighters (don’t want to ruin the surprise) and date confirmations for games we had known were in development already.

     We got a better look at many of the games we saw not too long ago in previous directs. Which pushes through that this is Nintendo’s main line up until Animal Crossing releases next year.

     While mildly disappointing that Animal Crossing was pushed back it’s nice to know Nintendo has confidence that Luigi’s Mansion and Pokemon: Sword & Shield can hold the rest of the year themselves.

But generally speaking the whole E3 event was a bit tame many things we knew were coming but not much to look forward too. Maybe we will get some news about Metroid later down the year.



Release Dates

The Witcher 3 - June 13, 2019
Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order - July 19, 2019
Luigi’s Mansion 3 - 2019 (maybe Halloween if we’re lucky)
Alien Isolation - 2019 (hopefully Halloween as well??)
The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening - September 20, 2019
Ni No Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch - September 20, 2019
Pokemon: Sword & Shield - November 15, 2019
Doom Eternal - 2019
Animal Crossing - March 20, 2020

Anything else will come up eventually.

summary: I love the Dark Crystal because it’s.... weird.  It’s very weird. Am not sure you can translate the “weird” into a game but I’ll...
body:
I love the Dark Crystal because it’s…. weird.  It’s very weird.

Am not sure you can translate the “weird” into a game but I’ll play it anyway.
